title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing. After performing the following steps, no children nodes are displayed: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
EB: After changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed. Following the steps mentioned below should result in children nodes being displayed: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source should have database/table/column information.
SR: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor. 3. Go to the data source page in the editor. 4. Change the data source to a different one. 5. Verify that the children nodes, representing database/table/column information, are displayed. 6. Close the data set editor and reopen it to confirm the children node listing persists.
